alert.note: Alert for Howard (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 01 at 3:35AM CST until January 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .A winter storm impacts the region from Monday evening through Tuesday night. Freezing rain develops Monday evening and gradually transitions to rain from south to north during the day on Tuesday. Total ice accumulations of two to four tenths of an inch are possible, with the best potential for the higher ice accumulations over southeast Minnesota. Several inches of snow are possible northwest of a Rochester, MN to Neilsville, WI line during the day on Tuesday. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of two to three tenths of an inch possible. * WHERE...In Iowa, Howard County. In Minnesota, Houston County. * WHEN...The best potential for freezing rain will be from Monday evening into Tuesday morning. Light snow is possible during the day on Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely should these ice accumulations develop. Travel could become very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There remains the potential for this storm to shift north or south. Travelers are urged to keep up to date with the latest forecasts and statements concerning this potentially hazardous travel situation.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
